title: The best players who might be available at the NFL trade deadline: Our 1-25 ranking
content: Here's how the top trade candidates -- including Trey Hendrickson, Chris Olave and even Mark Andrews -- stack up. Who is the top target to land before Nov. 4?

title: SGA's winning FTs put bow on 35-point ring night
content: On a night the Thunder received their championship rings, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander finished in style by hitting two free throws to lift Oklahoma City to a 125-124 double-overtime win over the Rockets.

title: QB Wilson calls out ex-coach Payton as 'classless'
content: Russell Wilson called out Sean Payton on social media after his former coach said after Sunday's game that he told Giants owner John Mara that he wished the team had waited to change quarterbacks until after they played the Broncos.

title: Steady Butler, 'matured' Kuminga lift Warriors
content: Jimmy Butler, with a focus on getting to the line and making free throws, and Jonathan Kuminga, with an offseason contract standoff behind him, helped lead the Warriors to a season-opening win over the Lakers.

title: Shedeur not getting starter reps behind Gabriel
content: Browns coach Kevin Stefanski said Wednesday that backup QB Shedeur Sanders is not receiving reps with the starting offense.

title: NFL moves Pro Bowl events to Super Bowl week
content: The NFL's Pro Bowl festivities are moving to Super Bowl week beginning this February, commissioner Roger Goodell announced Wednesday, with the annual AFC vs. NFC flag football game now set for Tuesday, Feb. 3.

title: Glenn knows who Jets' QB1 will be, but won't say
content: Jets coach Aaron Glenn said Wednesday that he knows who will start at quarterback Sunday against the Bengals but was not announcing his decision so as not to give his opponent a competitive advantage.

title: Trout: Was alerted to Kay's possible drug abuse
content: Mike Trout testified that he was alerted by a team employee to possible concerns about drug abuse by convicted ex-Angels communication director Eric Kay.

title: Izzo blasts NCAA for 'ridiculous' G League ruling
content: In the wake of two former G League players committing to play for Division I schools, Michigan State coach Tom Izzo sounded off Tuesday on the NCAA powerbrokers who've allowed those moves to happen.

title: 📉 Bottom 10: Miami back in a familiar place
content: As has become a midseason ritual, Miami suffered a loss it probably shouldn't have and ended up on our list.

title: Bilas' men's basketball 2025 preseason All-America teams
content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' preseason All-America teams.

title: Conference player of the year picks
content: From teammates to contenders for the No. 1 pick in the 2026 NBA draft, here are the frontrunners in each league.

title: Contender rankings for all 30 teams: Is their time now or later?
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram analyzes our Now or Later rankings, where the first-place team is the most desperate to win now and the 30th-place franchise is the most content to win later.

title: Kung fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A "traumatic experience" with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

content: Here's how the Dodgers' and Blue Jays' rosters stack up and who is primed to do the most jaw-dropping things on the sport's biggest stage.

content: A stunning finish cemented Michigan State player Jalen Watts-Jackson and Michigan fan Chris Baldwin into college football history.

content: Liz Loza is ready to embrace all possibilities at the confluence of "bye-mageddon" and National Tight End Day.

title: How to watch 'Inside the NBA' on ESPN: 2025-26 schedule
content: The 21-time Emmy Award-winning "Inside the NBA" studio show returns as the pregame, halftime and postgame show for ESPN and ABC's NBA coverage during the 2025-26 season.

title: Why the Mariners are built to be back after a crushing ALCS loss
content: The 2025 season was the closest Seattle has come to the World Series -- and the team believes the best is yet to come.

title: Why Barça vs. Villarreal in Miami was cancelled
content: Less than two weeks after LaLiga said Barcelona would play Villarreal in Miami, the first regular-season game abroad has been scrapped. What happened?

title: NFL Week 8 Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus unsung role players, nonstarters from every team
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 8. Plus, here are the unsung role players and nonstarters on each roster.

title: NFL replay review success rates have skyrocketed. A new camera feed may be why
content: Replay challenge success rates have increased by about half this year, largely fueled by a new camera angle.

title: Championship picture, schedule, stats and facts
content: Formula 1 ventures to Mexico City for round 20 of the 2025 season. Find out how the championship shapes up and everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: NBA season preview: Thunder lead loaded West; Flagg in a class of his own
content: Doug Greenberg explores the NBA betting storylines heading into the season, including the Thunder as heavy favorites and how sportsbooks are handling Cooper Flagg.

title: NFL Week 8: Colts huge favorites; Rodgers, Steelers underdogs to Packers
content: Aaron Rodgers and the Steelers are home underdogs to the Packers, and Bears-Ravens has the highest total.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Barcelona's Lewandowski
content: Manchester United could sign Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski as a free agent in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ranking the 10 greatest NWSL teams of all time: Who's No. 1?
content: Let's rank the 10 best NWSL teams since the league launched in 2013. How many Portland Thorns, Seattle Reign and Orlando Pride squads make the list?

title: Assam government to introduce bills on 'love jihad,' polygamy: Himanta
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said details will be shared once the draft bills are approved by the state cabinet

title: Ruling National Conference grapples with an upset Congress, piqued MP Ruhullah ahead of Assembly, Rajya Sabha bypolls
content: Congress skips the meeting for coalition partners chaired by NC chief Farooq Abdullah and CM Omar Abdullah; ruling party battles with MP Ruhullah’s decision to keep away from campaigns

title: NHAI to deploy 3D sensors to identify potholes, road cracks across 23 States
content: Data shall be collected for all projects involving two- to eight-lane highways by deploying vehicles equipped with advanced sensors and data acquisition systems

title: Air quality level ‘satisfactory’ in Bengaluru on third day of Deepavali
content: A light spell of rain on October 22 evening also could have contributed to an improvement in air quality as fewer people were seen bursting fire crackers compared to the previous two days

title: NSCN (I-M) leader Muivah returns home in Manipur after six decades
content: The State government had thwarted his earlier attempt to visit Somdal village in Ukhrul district in 2010

title: Watch: IT Ministry proposes strict rules for labelling deepfakes amid AI misuse
content: The Indian government has proposed new rules to regulate AI-generated content, requiring mandatory labeling and permanent metadata for deepfakes and synthetic media.

title: A.P. officials told to be alert as red alerts to continue till October 23 morning
content: Marripadu records 89.5 mm rain; NDRF and SDRF teams stationed in Nellore, Prakasam, Kadapa and Tirupati districts, says Home Minister

title: Congress slams Lokpal after anti-corruption body issues tender to purchase 7 BMW cars
content: Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi says it is ironic to see the anti-corruption body ordering BMWs for its members and the guardians of integrity chasing luxury over legitimacy

title: Weather system over Bay of Bengal unlikely to intensify; Heavy rains to persist over north Tamil Nadu this week
content: The northeast monsoon in its vigorous mode pounded most districts across the State. Periyakalapet in Puducherry recorded extremely heavy rainfall of 25 cm in the 24 hours ending 8:30 a.m. on October 22

title: NHRC issues notice to three States over attack on journalists
content: The National Human Rights Commission asked the Director Generals of Police of Kerala, Tripura and Manipur for detailed reports on the matter within two weeks

title: Congress hints at solo BMC poll bid; Bhai Jagtap seeks distance from MVA
content: Party MLC urges independent contest, citing grassroots mobilisation and internal Political Affairs Committee support

title: B. Tech graduate found dead in paying guest house
content: The security guard, with the help of others, shifted Pawan to a near-by hospital where the doctors declared him as brought dead

title: Andhra Pradesh introduces Common Zoning Regulations to streamline urban development
content: They mark the first-ever uniform framework for all Urban Local Bodies and Urban Development Authorities, replacing multiple master plans that have long caused ambiguity and procedural delays

title: Withdraw new Home Ministry directive on OCI status, says CPI(M) MP John Brittas
content: The August 12, 2025 notification allows for the cancellation of Overseas Citizenship of India status if a cardholder is chargesheeted for an offence carrying a sentence of seven years or more, even without a conviction

title: UKG kid quits classes after bus ride denial; AEO seeks action against HM
content: Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights registers case against ALP School, Chelembra, and begins investigation into denial of entry for five-year-old child on school bus.

title: CM Naidu invites Sharaf Group to invest in A.P.
content: Sharaf Group expresses willingness to invest in logistics and warehouses in A.P., while Transworld Group is keen to partner in setting up shipbuilding unit at Dugarajapatnam

title: Landing of President’s helicopter  on newly-laid turf triggers row
content: The chopper had originally been scheduled to land at Nilakkal, but unfavourable weather forced a last-minute change. Officials clarified that the helipad had been completed only hours before the President’s arrival, and its surface had not fully set due to damp weather

title: Great Green Wall to protect Andhra Pradesh’s coastline from cyclones and environmental degradation
content: An initiative of the Department of Environment, Forests, Science & Technology, the project spanning 5 km will comprise a multi-layered green buffer zone having mangroves, shelterbelt plantations, inland vegetation, and sand dunes that will reduce the impact of cyclones and storm surges, and stabilise shorelines

title: Congress comes down on LDF over move to join PM-SHRI scheme
content: AICC general secretary alleges that CPI(M) is deviating from its professed principles by supporting the PM-SHRI scheme

title: No accurate data on number of migrant workers in State
content: Unified portal and mobile application and Kerala Interstate Migrant Workers Welfare Registration Ordinance still being readied

title: CPI State executive weighs the ‘pros and cons’ of signing up for the NEP-linked PM-SHRI scheme
content: Party feels the LDF government should be wary of rising to the Centre’s “NEP bait. States that committing to PM-SHRI will implicitly signal adherence to the NEP, which infringes on federalism and, at a stroke, negates cultural, ethnic and linguistic diversities by seeking to centralise school education

title: NIMHANS launches new video series on mental health
content: The series on YouTube features mental health professionals from NIMHANS, offering valuable insights into a range of mental health conditions.

title: Over 130 cracker-related eye injury cases reported in Bengaluru; majority among children
content: Doctors said they are expecting more cases on Wednesday (October 22) night as it is the last day of the festivities.

title: IndiGo Flight Makes Emergency Landing In Varanasi After Fuel Leak: Cops
content: An Indigo flight from Kolkata to Srinagar made an emergency landing at Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, following a fuel leak.

title: "Disgrace": BJP vs Trinamool After Kali Idol Taken Away In Police Van
content: A massive political storm is brewing in Bengal over alleged vandalism of a Kali idol at Kakdwip near Sundarbans.

title: 3 Injured As MLA's Son Rams Audi Into 2 Cars, Attacks Man Driving One Of Them
content: A school student and son of a former Rajasthan minister who drove an Audi despite being underage ended up ramming two other cars in Jaipur, the police said.

title: "Dilli Duur Hai": Devendra Fadnavis Rules Out National Role Till 2029
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said he will continue in the present post till 2029, and the composition of the ruling coalition will remain unchanged.

title: Cadbury, Mars Fought Over 'Celebrations' Mark For 25 Years, Then A Sweet End
content: The Delhi High Court recorded a settlement between Mars Incorporated and Cadbury (India) Ltd over the use of the mark CELEBRATIONS', bringing an end to a nearly 25-year-old trademark dispute between the two confectionery giants.

title: Newborn Set To Lose Hand After Greater Noida Hospital Gives Her Wrong Injection
content: A newborn baby's hand will need to be amputated after alleged negligence by a nursing home in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, where she was administered the wrong injection.

title: National Highways In 23 States To Be Monitored By AI, Survey Vehicles
content: State-owned NHAI on Wednesday said it will deploy Network Survey Vehicles (NSV) in 23 states covering 20,933 km for the collection, processing and analysis of road inventory and pavement condition data of National Highway stretches.

title: Putin Directs Drills Of Nuclear Forces As Summit With Trump Put On Hold
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday directed drills of the country's strategic nuclear forces that featured practice missile launches, an exercise that came as his planned summit on Ukraine with US President Donald Trump was put on hold.

title: Northeast's Biggest Armed Group's Leader, In Talks With Centre, Visits Home In Manipur After 50 Years
content: Thuingaleng Muivah, the 91-year-old chief of the northeast's largest insurgent group NSCN(IM), returned to his village today in Manipur's Ukhrul district - where he has not set foot for 50 years.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Hack Dealt $2.5-Billion Blow To British Economy: Report
content: The August hack of Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), owned by India's Tata Motors, cost the British economy 1.9 billion pounds ($2.55 billion) and affected over 5,000 organisations in the country, an independent cybersecurity body said in a report.

title: "Spit In The Face": Zelensky Slams "Brazen" Russian Attack On Kindergarten
content: A Russian drone attack struck a kindergarten in Ukraine's second-largest city, Kharkiv, on Wednesday, killing one person and injuring seven others, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

title: 3 Killed As Royal Enfield Bike Hits Unmarked Concrete Divider In Delhi
content: Three men, including two cousins, were killed after their motorcycle rammed into an unmarked jersey barrier on the Libaspur flyover on the GT Road while they were returning from Haryana's Murthal after dinner, an official said on Wednesday.

title: King Charles To Become 1st British Monarch In 500 Years To Pray With Pope
content: King Charles III leaves for a state visit to the Vatican on Wednesday, where he will meet Pope Leo XIV and make history as the first head of the Church of England to pray publicly with the pontiff since the schism between the churches 500 years ago.

title: Why Jewels Worth $102 Million Lost In Louvre Heist May Never Be Recovered
content: The glittering sapphires, emeralds, and diamonds that once adorned France's royals could well be gone forever, experts said after the Louvre heist.

title: Centre Proposes Labelling AI Content To Protect Users From Deepfakes
content: To curb user harm from AI-generated deepfakes and synthetically produced content, the IT Ministry has proposed draft amendments to IT rules that mandate labelling and prominent markers to ensure users can distinguish synthetic and authentic content

title: "Disarming Hamas Will Be A Tough Task," Says JD Vance
content: US Vice President JD Vance warned Wednesday of the tough task ahead in disarming Hamas and building a peaceful future for Gaza, as Washington sought to reassure its ally Israel over the next steps in its ambitious ceasefire deal.

title: Journalists Imprisoned In Belarus, Georgia Win EU's Top Human Rights Award
content: Two journalists, one imprisoned in Belarus and the other in Georgia, have won the European Union's top human rights honour, the Sakharov Prize, European Parliament President Roberta Metsola announced on Wednesday.

title: Israel Identifies 2 More Bodies Of Hostages As JD Vance Meets Netanyahu
content: Israel has completed the identification of the bodies of two more hostages, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said Wednesday, as US Vice President JD Vance held high-level meetings in Israel to nudge forward Gaza's fragile ceasefire.

title: "Amiu Zubeen": Assam BJP's Rally Calls for Justice In Zubeen Garg's Death
content: The streets of Nalbari turned into a sea of emotion on Wednesday as thousands joined the "Moiu Zubeen, Amiu Zubeen" (I am Zubeen, We are Zubeen) rally, organised by the Assam BJP, seeking justice for the late music icon Zubeen Garg.

title: Jaipur Couple Found Dead, Police Suspect Murder-Suicide Over Marital Discord
content: A couple was found dead inside their home in Jaipur's Jamdoli area, with police suspecting it to be a case of murder-suicide triggered by marital discord.

title: President to  visit Kottayam on Thursday
content: President Droupadi Murmu will be the chief guest of the valedictory ceremony of the platinum jubilee of St. Thomas Autonomous College, Pala

title: Majority of wellness Ayurveda players outside Kerala Tourism’s classification
content: Only less than 60 players have registered with the department, while over 150 are actively operating in the sector in Kerala without any classification

title: Release ₹2,700 crore Aarogyasri dues, demands APCC chief Sharmila
content: With the suspension of services by the empanelled hospitals, patients are suffering, the Congress party leader says, and warns of indefinite hunger strike if the government does not do the needful

title: With Karnataka Social and Educational Survey set to resume, all eyes are on its progress in Bengaluru region
content: The survey in Greater Bengaluru Authority region, which started on October 4, has managed to record a progress of about 45.97%

title: A.P. CM Naidu begins UAE tour, pushes for investment in green energy, data centres
content: Sobha Group Chairman Ravi P.N.C. Menon offers ₹100 crore for the establishment of a world-class library in Amaravati

title: Railway employee avails instant loan, harassed and blackmailed for double the amount
content: The police have advised people to stay away from instant loan apps to avoid harassment and cyber frauds

title: Andhra Pradesh government will clear pending housing bills soon, says Minister Parthasarathy
content: Government identifying causes of dissatisfaction among people in the housing sector and trying to address them, the Minister says

title: Satish Jarkiholi well-suited to provide leadership to politics of liberal, progressive ideology: Yathindra Siddaramaiah
content: ‘My father is in the last phase of his political career,’ CM Siddaramaiah’s son said; clarified that he did not name Satish Jarkiholi as his father’s successor

title: Kingpin of ₹300‑crore multi-State fraud arrested after six months on the run
content: Sri Sathya Sai police apprehend Morimi Shetty Suresh, alias Dal Mill Suri, in Warangal; 57 cases filed across five States, with steps underway to seize his properties.

title: More than 70 persons injured in Vellore and nearby districts while bursting crackers
content: Among the injured, many patients were treated for burns, eye injuries, and minor trauma resulting from firecracker mishaps.

title: IT Minister Lokesh moots Griffith University India Centre in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Minister, during his ongoing tour of Australia, meets top officials of Griffith University, James Cook University, and Populous Architects, and pushes for collaboration in education, aquaculture, and sports infrastructure

title: Traffic restrictions issued for heavy vehicles in Gudiyatham
content: According to a press release, traffic restrictions for heavy vehicles are aimed to facilitate smooth flow of traffic in Gudiyatham town

title: Two tonnes of firecrackers seized from residential area near Walajah
content: In the wake of the death of four persons after a fire broke out at an illegal cracker godown near Avadi, Collector J. U. Chandrakala formed special teams to crack such illegal godowns in the district.

title: IT Rules 2021 amendment to add ‘accountability’ for State, Central governments
content: The move is aimed at curbing overreach by junior police officials at the State level, and introduces a periodic review of social media takedown notices, said officials

title: Telangana abolishes transport check posts to enhance transparency and efficiency
content: The Transport department will now turn to artificial intelligence tools across 63 centres of the department to record who enters and exits offices of the department

title: Inside Arthur Road Jail: Belgian Court shown pictures of barrack where Mehul Choksi may be kept
content: The submission is part of an official affidavit by the Government of India before the Belgian Court, where Mehul Choksi has opposed his extradition, citing alleged threats to his life and concerns about prison conditions in India

title: Palaniswami levelling false allegations on paddy procurement: T.N. Agriculture Minister
content: In the last four-and-a-half years, the DMK government has taken prompt action in matters related to paddy procurement, says M.R.K. Panneerselvam

title: Government to procure six fast patrol boats for armed forces, issues Request for Proposal
content: According to the the Request for Proposal issued, the boat shall also be employed to carry out patrolling and surveillance of conflict zone

title: Thamarassery clash: MP seeks district administration’s intervention
content: He claims that pollution issues related to the slaughterhouse waste management company have been troubling residents for long

title: Delhi High Court judge Prathiba M. Singh appointed as chair of WIPO’s advisory board
content: Apart from Justice Singh, the board includes nine other members who will provide guidance and direction to World Intellectual Property Organization’s work with judiciaries

title: BJP Bengal chief warns party leaders over laxity during proposed SIR drive
content: He reportedly warned that any negligence in implementing the SIR could prove politically disastrous for the party in the run-up to the 2026 assembly polls

title: Karnataka envious of Andhra Pradesh’s success in attracting investments, says BJP State chief Madhav
content: By roping in some of the world’s most prominent companies to invest in Andhra Pradesh, the coalition government has proved its capability to transform the State into a preferred destination for global entrepreneurs, he says

title: 'Insult to Hindus': BJP after Kali idol 'desecrated', taken away in prison van in Bengal
content: Desecration of a Goddess Kali idol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district sparked outrage, with the BJP accusing the TMC government of shielding culprits. Police are investigating the damaged idol, found in a village temple, and warned against misinformation. The incident occurred amidst protests and stone-pelting, leading to police intervention.

title: Louvre loot: Who buys a stolen crown? Inside the global black market for royal jewels
content: Four thieves executed a swift heist at the Louvre, stealing $102 million in crown jewels. Experts warn the real crime is the impending dismantling and sale of these historical treasures on the black market. This brazen theft highlights a growing international criminal economy targeting cultural heritage for its commodity value, making recovery unlikely.

title: Clearing the air: Delhi's AQI 2000+ or under 400? Why apps show different figures
content: Delhi residents were confused by vastly different pollution readings on Tuesday. While India's CPCB showed AQI below 400, international apps like IQAir reported over 2,000. Experts explain these discrepancies stem from different calculation methods and data sources, though both indicate dangerously poor air quality post-Diwali.

title: Sarfaraz's snub turns political: BJP hits back - ' Desh ka partition karke mann nahi bhara'
content: Congress spokesperson Shama Mohamed accused India head coach Gautam Gambhir of religious bias in team selection after Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion from the India 'A' squad. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla strongly refuted the allegations, calling them divisive. Sarfaraz Khan has a strong first-class record and recently scored a century in his last international series.

title: Microsoft's new RTO policy: Allows work from home for some roles; sends memo to employees
content: Microsoft is reportedly exempting some client-facing sales and solution engineering roles from its upcoming return-to-office mandate, signaling a more flexible approach. This decision acknowledges the unique demands of these positions, contrasting with a broader industry trend of scaling back remote work options. The company emphasizes its commitment to flexibility where it is practical.

title: 'Pakistan Zindabad': Fan shouts at Shubman Gill; Captain handles it perfectly - watch
content: Indian ODI captain Shubman Gill encountered a surprising moment in Australia. A fan, during a handshake, shouted 'Pakistan Zindabad'. Gill appeared momentarily stunned and then continued his walk. The incident, captured on video, has circulated widely online. The Indian team is currently in Australia for an ODI series. Gill is focused on the upcoming match.

title: Mid-air scare: IndiGo flight suffers fuel leak; makes emergency landing in Varanasi
content: An IndiGo flight from Kolkata to Srinagar, Flight 6E-6961, made an emergency landing in Varanasi due to a detected fuel leak. All 166 passengers and crew were safely evacuated without injuries. Airport operations have resumed as authorities investigate the cause of the leak.

title: ChatGPT gets browser: Google loses $150B; Chrome monopoly threat
content: OpenAI's new AI browser, ChatGPT Atlas, has shaken the tech world.  The launch caused a massive $150 billion drop in Alphabet's market value.  CEO Sam Altman called it a rare chance to redefine web browsing.  Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly, allowing AI to perform tasks.  This poses a significant challenge to Google's search advertising revenue.  Investors are watching closely as Google also integrates AI into its Chrome browser.  The competition for browser dominance is heating up.

title: Railways may allow rescheduling of e-tickets without extra cost- how would it work
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce a new feature allowing passengers to change their confirmed e-ticket journey dates without cancellation or extra charges. This initiative, expected early next year, aims to enhance passenger convenience by enabling date modifications directly through the IRCTC website or app, subject to seat availability.

title: AI regulation: LinkedIn cofounder’s ‘clarification’ on Anthropic; backs Google, OpenAI
content: LinkedIn cofounder Reid Hoffman has defended AI firm Anthropic and tech giants like Google and OpenAI against accusations of regulatory capture. He praised these companies for deploying AI responsibly, contrasting them with others he claims disregard safety. The debate intensified with responses from White House AI czar David Sacks and Elon Musk, while Anthropic's CEO also issued a rebuttal.

title: Lamar Jackson fires back at Dov Kleiman’s viral post, calls him ‘weirdo’
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson publicly rebuked a viral NFL content creator for a misleading post, highlighting team struggles amid a 1-5 start.  Injuries and inconsistent play plague Baltimore, with a crucial home game against the Bears looming. Jackson's return is vital as the team desperately seeks a turnaround, facing immense pressure to silence off-field drama and refocus on the field.

title: 'Mungeri Lal ke sapne': Chirag Paswan hits out at Mahagathbandhan over 'ongoing infighting'
content: Chirag Paswan launched a scathing attack on the Mahagathbandhan, declaring it has collapsed and their power aspirations are mere "Mungeri Lal ke sapne." He questioned the alliance's coordination, specifically targeting Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav. Paswan also defended Chief Minister Nitish Kumar against personal attacks, highlighting the NDA's unity and focus on development.

title: Clippers vs Jazz preview: Date, time, where to watch, expected lineup & prediction
content: The Utah Jazz will host the Los Angeles Clippers on Wednesday, October 22, to tip off the 2025-26 NBA season at Delta Center. The Jazz, coming off a rebuilding year, face questions about their progress, while the Clippers boast an experienced core aiming to contend. This matchup offers an early glimpse into both teams' potential.

title: British Raj in Australia? Team India head to favourite restaurant to celebrate Diwali - watch
content: Team India celebrated Diwali together at Adelaide's British Raj restaurant, boosting morale after their ODI series opener loss. Players like Kohli and Rohit Sharma were seen interacting with fans. This pre-match dinner aims to foster team bonding and a renewed focus for the crucial second ODI at Adelaide Oval, where India seeks to level the series.

title: 'Locked him in for days': Big revelation by ex-DGP held in son's death case
content: Former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and his wife, Razia Sultana, are under probe for their son's death, which they attribute to drug overdose. Mustafa revealed his son's 18-year drug addiction and violent episodes, claiming a video alleging foul play was a product of his son's psychotic disorder and is being misused.

title: Doug Martin death probe: New details link CTE, mental health, police detention
content: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known as "Muscle Hamster," died at 36 after being taken into police custody in Oakland. His family stated he was experiencing mental health issues, while police responded to a possible break-in. Martin's brain will be tested for CTE as an investigation into his death is ongoing.

title: Bhai Dooj 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Bhai Dooj, celebrated two days after Diwali, honors the strong bond between brothers and sisters. This year, it falls on October 22, with sisters praying for their brothers' well-being and brothers pledging protection. The festival is a time for joy, gifts, and cherishing lifelong connections, even across distances.

title: History made! 38-year-old debutant shocks cricket world; breaks 92-year-old record
content: Pakistan's Asif Afridi etched his name in cricket history, becoming the oldest debutant to claim a five-wicket haul at 38. Despite his impressive feat, South Africa's tailenders fought back, reducing the deficit. Afridi's remarkable performance places him among elite Pakistani spinners, surpassing a 92-year-old record.

title: Big changes in IT Rules soon? Centre mulls tweaks - AI, deepfakes in focus
content: India's IT ministry is proposing new rules to combat AI-generated deepfakes and synthetic content. Social media giants with over 50 lakh users must identify and label artificial content, ensuring users can distinguish it from reality. These measures aim to boost accountability and user awareness amidst growing concerns over AI misuse.

title: Watch: Shots fired outside Serbian parliament; President calls it 'terrorist attack'
content: Shots were fired outside Serbia's parliament in Belgrade, injuring one person and prompting President Aleksandar Vucic to label it a "terrorist attack." A video captured security officers near a tent, followed by gunfire and a fire. The injured man is in stable condition, and authorities are investigating the incident.

title: ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’ BO collection day 21 - Rishab Shetty-starrer crosses Rs 550 cr mark
content: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is a box office sensation, crossing ₹550 crore in India three weeks post-release. Its strong performance through Diwali, with significant earnings daily, highlights its pan-India appeal beyond Karnataka. The film's universal themes resonate widely, impacting its OTT release date, which is now uncertain due to continued theatrical success.

title: Delhi had a blast: In Karol Bagh, it was a scream! Stations exceeded standard decibel levels
content: Delhi's Diwali festivities ringing in this year brought an unexpected surge of noise, with several monitoring stations recording decibel levels well beyond what is legally acceptable. Even with a green cracker initiative and allotted hours for bursting, the decibel meter was pushed to its limits, particularly from 9 pm until 11 pm, spilling over into the night across many regions.

title: Yogi Adityanath defends Halal ban; says ended Eid milan tradition at CM house
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath defended the state's ban on Halal-certified products, alleging funds were misused for terrorism, 'love jihad,' and conversions. He stated these certifications operate as an unregulated system, earning significant amounts without official recognition. Adityanath also discussed the secularization of official events, emphasizing inclusivity beyond religious celebrations.

title: 'Not even Magnus Carlsen': How Norway Chess did what Freestyle couldn't - exclusive
content: In a twist that’s shaken up the global chess scene, Norway Chess has pulled off what even Magnus Carlsen’s Freestyle tour couldn’t, convincing FIDE to approve a brand-new World Championship title. The “Total Chess World Championship” marks a stunning power play that could redefine how elite chess is played and governed.

title: Delhi air pollution: At peak hours, data goes blank at many stations
content: Air quality monitoring stations in Delhi experienced significant data gaps during peak pollution hours, with several stations going offline when PM2.5 and PM10 levels neared 1,000 µg/m³. Experts allege this skews 24-hour averages and hinders understanding of pollution's impact. Authorities, however, deny any missing data.

title: Watch: Disturbed by firecrackers, stray dog boards metro in Kolkata
content: Caught on camera during the festivities of Diwali, a stray dog’s unexpected ride on the Kolkata Metro has melted hearts online. Seeking refuge from bursting fireworks, the canine commuter wandered through compartments in search of calm, winning over every commuter along the way. Watch the touching moment that’s reminding everyone what compassion looks like this Diwali.

title: 'If you want trophy': New twist in Asia Cup row; Naqvi sends stern message to BCCI
content: A dispute has erupted between the BCCI and PCB over the Asia Cup trophy presentation. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi insists on personally handing the trophy to India in Dubai on November 10, following India's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This stems from tensions between the Indian team and the ACC president.

title: Travis Kelce, Mahomes’ 1587 Prime slammed over $16 menu item
content: NFL stars Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce's upscale steakhouse, 1587 Prime, is facing online ridicule after a viral photo showcased $16 mashed potatoes.  Launched with significant fanfare, the restaurant's pricing and food quality are now under intense scrutiny, sparking a debate about celebrity-driven ventures versus genuine culinary value. This marks the venture's first public criticism.

title: Are Fortnite servers not responding? How to fix on PS5, PC and Xbox
content: Fortnite players facing server connection problems can find solutions here. The article outlines common reasons for outages, including Epic Games maintenance and network issues. It provides step-by-step fixes for PS5, PC, and Xbox users. Simple restarts, checking internet connections, and reinstalling the game are suggested. Players are advised to be patient during updates as issues often resolve quickly.

title: 'Tufat al-Muminat': JeM launches online 'jihadi course' for women; will charge PKR 500
content: Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched an online training course, 'Tufat al-Muminat,' led by Masood Azhar's sister, to recruit women and raise funds. This initiative, following the formation of its women's wing, signals a strategic shift, potentially involving female suicide attackers. The group continues to operate and solicit donations openly, despite international scrutiny.

title: Eknath Chitnis passes away: Isro pioneer was 100; built India’s first telecom satellite
content: Isro scientist Dr Eknath Chitnis has passed away at the age of 100. He was a foundational figure at the Indian Space Research Organisation. Dr Chitnis worked with Dr Homi Bhabha in the early days. He was instrumental in developing India's first telecommunication satellite, INSAT. This satellite advanced the nation's space communication capabilities.

title: Stephen A Smith’s bold take: Dak Prescott, Cowboys won’t win NFC East title
content: Despite Dak Prescott's strong offensive performance, Stephen A. Smith expressed doubt about the Dallas Cowboys winning the NFC East, citing their historically bad defense. Smith highlighted the team's league-worst defensive statistics, arguing that offensive prowess alone cannot overcome these significant flaws. The Cowboys face a crucial test against the Denver Broncos.

title: IND vs AUS: Why India will level ODI series in Adelaide - here are the numbers
content: India faces a crucial second ODI against Australia at Adelaide, needing a series-saving performance from veterans Kohli and Sharma after their Perth defeat. The team grapples with the absence of Pandya and the Adelaide pitch's expected challenges. Australia welcomes back Zampa and Carey, while India ponders bowling options amid batting concerns.

title: Watch: Neeraj Chopra conferred honorary rank of Lt Colonel in Army
content: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has been appointed Lieutenant Colonel (Honorary) in the Indian Army. This honour follows his distinguished military career and numerous athletic achievements. Chopra's journey includes significant awards like the Arjuna Award, Khel Ratna, and Padma Shri. His recent participation in the World Athletics Championships also saw him compete strongly.

title: Mike Trout reveals shocking details on Tyler Skaggs’ fentanyl death
content: Baseball star Mike Trout gave emotional testimony in a California courtroom. He spoke about the 2019 death of his teammate Tyler Skaggs. Skaggs died from a drug overdose. The trial will decide if the Los Angeles Angels are responsible. Former team employee Eric Kay is accused of providing the fatal pill. Skaggs' family seeks damages.

title: Tullis-Joyce's rise to USWNT, Man United No. 1 (via a rainforest)
content: the summer break offers the opportunity to jet off to glitzy locations like Ibiza or Dubai . the 29-year-old goalkeeper is a real fan favorite at the club . she has been working with a researcher called Dr. Rosa Vásquez Espinoza .

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Bo Nix, downgrade Quinshon Judkins
content: the matchup rankings provide a schedule-independent method to evaluate positional matchups each week . we calibrate points-allowed data to show how each defense fared relative to the difficulty of the schedule it has faced . "adj. FPA," or adjusted fantasy points allowed, reflects how fa .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 8
content: a team with Would be in status is featured in this week's top-12 projection . teams with Work to do are the true bubble teams and the first ones outside the bracket . one team with work to do is passing the eye test and has a chance at winning its conference .

title: Ranking every open Power 4 job in college football
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . no coach is safe, but a strong line of storms has been forecasted . a total of 298-150 coaches have been fired from the power conference .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: The NBA season is here! Expert picks for East, West and NBA champs
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder begin their quest to repeat against Kevin Durant and the Houston Rockets . they re-signed 2025 MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander , All-Star Jalen Williams and Chet Holmgren to deals worth nearly $800 million . in the loaded Western Conference, Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warriors begin their first full campaign with Jimmy Butler .

title: Ranking the 6 UFC championship fights still to come in 2025
content: Tom Aspinall will defend his undisputed heavyweight title against former interim titleholder Ciryl Gane . Virna Jandiroba will meet Mackenzie Dern for the 115-pound title that Zhang Weili vacated earlier this year to move up to flyweight . the co-main event also finds Zhang trying to become a flyweight champion .

title: Power Rankings: Alabama climbs into the top 5; four new teams join the list
content: Georgia quarterback Gunner Stockton delivers in a big moment once again in the win over the Rebels . the bulldogs are gaining steam in the college football playoff race . a team of top players is gaining momentum in college football .

title: Which NHL teams have the most to prove in 2025-26? Placing 13 teams into tiers
content: few teams in NHL history have proved themselves in the face of doubters more than the Florida Panthers of the past few seasons . this season will be defined by the teams outside of South Florida that need to do a lot of proving of their own .
